newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian money market inactive due to Bombay holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian money market inactive due to Bombay holiday.

text.p: Indian money markets were lifeless on Thursday as banks in Bombay, the country's commercial capital, were closed for a local holiday.
Indian call money ended Wednesday at 7.5-8.5 percent against the Tuesday's close of 8.75-9.25 as the impact of central bank dollar purchases was felt by the domestic money market, dealers said.
Dealers said Reserve Bank of India (RBI) dollar purchases injected liquidity into the banking system and helped push call money rates down.
